entry.title: Allow for video capturers to provide sample timestamps.
entry.content:
This CL adds support to provide OS-provided sample timestamps

into VideoFrame::metadata().capture_begin_time. With the change,

VideoCaptureDevice::Client methods accepting frames are getting

a new optional base::TimeTicks indicating an optional capture

begin time. The present timestamps are used in different parts

of chrome and can't be re-purposed.



No capturers were updated to supply the new timestamp, this CL

only has the plumbing.

entry.title: [Audio] Propagate socket errors to sinks and sources. Prevent reuse.
entry.content:
If the browser side closes the socket the renderer is only notified

through a failure to read from the socket. This error was being dropped

instead of propagated to the RenderCallback and CaptureCallback.



This error signal is then used to prevent reuse of AudioRendererMixer

instances. This fixes the linked issue (same-origin navigations where

the mixer is reused between navigations).



There may still be constructions where a RenderFrame which creates a

shared sink is closed while the sink is being used. I haven't yet been

able to construct such a scenario though.



Bug: 326903566



Change-Id: I45c6ce12327315540590dab9ae545fa7327a9d83

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5331283

entry.title: Revert "Fix wrong PLSA::ShouldScrollOnMainThread after CSS overflow change"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 30753ceb52480bd80aef5e755885d7b79648e108.



Reason for revert: Now MainThreadScrollingDidChange() is not called.

We need to verify if it's OK to call UpdateCompositorAnimations()

without calling MainThreadScrollingDidChange() (which seems to do

more than UpdateCompositorAnimations() does).

Revert first for safety.



Original change's description:

> Fix wrong PLSA::ShouldScrollOnMainThread after CSS overflow change

>

> Previously PLSA::SetShouldScrollOnMainThread() was called only for

> user-scrollable scrollable areas, and missed the case when a

> composited composited scrollable area became not user-scrollable

> (and not-composited), causing wrong scroll animation running on the

> wrong thread.

>

> Now remove PLSA::SetShouldScrollOnMainThread() and let

> PLSA::ShouldScrollOnMainThread() always return the correct status.

> In most cases the function is not called at all, or just once for

> each animating scroller, so the new code actually costs less.

>

> Bug: 326498383

> Change-Id: I1c498d143e3f7580f57204606bbbc5faafe6ee28

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332198

> Reviewed-by: Stefan Zager

> Commit-Queue: Xianzhu Wang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266797}



Bug: 326498383

Change-Id: Iebb5502f7e8a93cdcc212a647e622b6edfa1dca5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334151

entry.title: [cfm-a11y]: ash side toggle for ChromeVox
entry.content:
Currently, ChromeVox on CFM devices has a special toggle path:

- TouchAccessibilityEnabler::OnTimer

-> AccessibilityManager::OnTwoFingersTouch[Start|Stop]

-> extensions::EventRouter::BroadcastEvent(accessibility_private_on_two_fingers_start_or_stop_event)

-> Meet app js listening to

chrome.accessibilityPrivate.onTwoFingersTouch[Start|Stop]

-> Meet app js calls

chrome.accessibilityFeatures.spokenFeedback.set

-> in Ash, toggles ChromeVox



This change simplifies this path just to:

- TouchAccessibilityEnabler::OnTimer

-> in Ash, toggles ChromeVox



Bug: 327492307

Test: manually by CFM team

Change-Id: I45bba61e96f046e9896114d2ed3d406cbb3d6ff8

entry.title: Revert "Use the end position without increasing the offset for a new line"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 028fd39e54cf5f12f9860d3a3e9073c230d27991.



Reason for revert: Caused test regressions



Original change's description:

> Use the end position without increasing the offset for a new line

>

> This CL doesn't increase the end offset to get the range for a new

> line character at RangeForParagraphSplittingTextNodesIfNeeded() and it

> fixes duplicating texts on indenting a pre block since the end position

> points a new line character correctly.

> If it increases the offset, the position doesn't point a new line

> character and InRenderedText() returns false. When VisiblePosition for

> the position that has a new line character is created, it points the

> next node and clones the next node together.

>

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: use SingleThreadTaskRunner for event poll
entry.content:
V4L2StatefulVD uses a SequencedTaskRunner from a pool to block while

waiting for events from the V4L2 driver. Said pool can and usually

does reuse the actual thread servicing the TaskRunner; when there are

multiple video decodes in parallel, eventually they'll block each

other. This is found by Tast tests e.g. like h264_720p_30fps_hw_3x3.

This CL fixes that by using SingleThreadTaskRunners instead. A similar

situation was found and fixed with a CL similar to this in

https://crrev.com/c/5253818.



Bug: b:318426433, b:326295895

entry.content:
When Bind is used with const T& type it still makes a copy of the

argument. As a result, RecentSource::Params were copied every time

we descend into another directory, on ARC or local disk (this does

not happen on Drive). This CL removes this copying by storing params

in the context and just using call_id.

entry.title: Fix wrong PLSA::ShouldScrollOnMainThread after CSS overflow change
entry.content:
Previously PLSA::SetShouldScrollOnMainThread() was called only for

user-scrollable scrollable areas, and missed the case when a

composited composited scrollable area became not user-scrollable

(and not-composited), causing wrong scroll animation running on the

wrong thread.



Now remove PLSA::SetShouldScrollOnMainThread() and let

PLSA::ShouldScrollOnMainThread() always return the correct status.

In most cases the function is not called at all, or just once for

each animating scroller, so the new code actually costs less.

entry.title: Revert "Use GetCurrentDefault() for BufferingBytesConsumer::CreateWithDelay()."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0d35826b1ee3f60b69a7fe887c4fabae83bf6ab3.



Reason for revert:

According to https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/platform/scheduler/TaskSchedulingInBlink.md, GetCurrentDefault() is banned.

Also, we confirmed that the root cause of the issue is not unexpected thread hop for delayed tasks, but how the crash library is made. We actually do not need this CL.



Original change's description:

> Use GetCurrentDefault() for BufferingBytesConsumer::CreateWithDelay().

>

> We assume that the root cause of TSan issue is running timeout timer

> in the different thread. To avoid that, we intend to run the timeout

> timer in the default thread, which is usually be the current task

> runner, instead of running it in the given thread, which may not be

> the current task runner.

>

> Additional change:

> - To ensure the methods are called from the same thread, all methods

> starts to DCHECK the sequence.

>

> Change-Id: Ia77682e00d81a65f342f613cdd25a94582ff1053

entry.title: Reland "[Files app] Make `GuestOsSharePath` depend on `VolumeManager`"
entry.content:
This reverts commit acd622834998c87bb47b7a3db276abda0c7126a4.



Reason for revert: Reland with fix in CrostiniSshfsHelperTest



Original change's description:

> Revert "[Files app] Make `GuestOsSharePath` depend on `VolumeManager`"

>

> This reverts commit 4a3c90aceee14e4502da1b529398e16977e35cc2.

>

> Reason for revert: https://crbug.com/1491372, CrostiniSshfsHelperTest failing

>

> Original change's description:

> > [Files app] Make `GuestOsSharePath` depend on `VolumeManager`

> >

> > The `GuestOsSharePath` currently registers as an observer of

> > `VolumeManager` in it's constructor and de-registers in its Shutdown

> > method. It's possible that `VolumeManager` is destructed before

> > `GuestOsSharePath` and in the Shutdown method it then tries to create a

> > `VolumeManager` instance.

> >

> > This adds the DependsOn explicitly in the `GuestOsSharePathFactory` and

> > adds a new method to just find the existing `VolumeManager` instead of

> > trying to create a new one. The former is probably not strictly

> > necessary given the DependsOn, but can't hurt to ensure a new one isn't

> > created.

> >

> > Furthermore this ensures the observer is removed from the `DriveFsHost`

> > and updates to use `base::ScopedObservation` instead. Given the

> > dependency on `DriveFsHost` this also ensures a `DependsOn` is added

> > for `drive::DriveIntegrationService` as well.

> >

> > Bug: b/297425959

> > Change-Id: Ica847e4c676be5b4a107657f6404444df410c13f

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4914293

entry.title: ImageBitmap: Update Source Alpha State if Redecoding Happens
entry.content:
Create ImageBitmap from HTMLImageElement might trigger redecoding

in some cases to redecode the source to dst alpha state.

However, ImageBitmap creation steps recorded source

alpha state before redecoding step and use that out-dated states to

choose whether further alpha changes should be adopted.



This introduces bug when further operations take redecoded image as

input but use out-dated alpha state. E.g. Creating ImageBitmap with

{premultiplyAlpha: "none", imageOrientation: "flipY"} failed to adopt

effect of premultiplyAlpha: "none".



This CL update source alpha type if redecoding happens to fix the

behaviour.



Bug: chromium:1514809

Change-Id: I6f322320eaaf09dc32a8a55bf7b8ebc1bc0290e5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5312881

entry.title: [Extensions] Add a test for service worker corruption
entry.content:
Add a basic test for detecting corruption of an extension service

worker. As part of making content verification easier to test, also

introduce a new helper method that allows tests to override whether

an extension should be verified by content verification. This way,

the test doesn't have to either

* Set up complex enterprise policies, or

* Use real hashes that are signed by the webstore



This CL has no behavior change.

entry.content:
This CL is a refactor only to move code. There is no change of logic.



A separate SecurityDelegate is created for each VM, and potentially for

other clients such as lacros and arc. By moving the file sharing and

translation functions to SecurityDelegate we can allow each VM to do the

different path translations required.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Modify title checks in PDF Extension JS tests
entry.content:
Refactor PDF title checks in Extension JS tests so that they can run

with both OOPIF PDF viewer and GuestView PDF viewer.



A future change will not set PDF title using document.title

entry.title: Applying LCP Timing Predictor to Speculation Rules API
entry.content:
Design doc(Google internal): https://docs.google.com/document/d/13LIGWjzKw-lpw95eF-8ylK4uSGnZPJwg60vYE5Av0Oo/edit?usp=sharing



This CL applies the LCP Timing Predictor to DocumentSpeculationRules

whereby it delays prerender to improve the main page LCP.



If kLCPTimingPredictorPrerender2 is enabled, PrerendererImpl in

browser defers prerender requests until DocumentSpeculationRules in

renderer sends OnLCPPredicted(), which is sent when Chrome

detects the LCP(see [2] for the detail).



[2] LCP timing predictor callback algorithm(Google internal)

https://docs.google.com/document/d/19ROdffa-F-_rOk8PDWOAHGgBDtR1W0jRPN7g4LDw7Qc/edit?usp=sharing



Testing is done by adding new flags to the existing Prerender2 virtual

test.

entry.title: [Extensions c2s] Add action title to toolbar action's hover card
entry.content:
Add the action's title in the toolbar action's hover card whenever it's

existent (that is, title is not the same as the extension name or is not

null). This way, we match current functionality that shows action's

title on the action's tooltip.



We add a new method that returns the action name to the action view

controller. We don't use GetTooltip() because 1) this is technically

not a tooltip and 2) we only need the action name, and no site access

text.

entry.title: Make PaintPropertyNode classes polymorphic
entry.content:
Benefits are:

1. The sparse vector in ObjectPaintProperties becomes more memory

efficient by avoiding the extra 4*n or 8*n bytes for the identifier

field of std::variant.

2. It simplifies code to handle PaintPropertyNodes (e.g. in

PaintPropertyTreePrinter).

3. It makes it easier to convert to Oilpan.



Drawbacks are:

1. vtable pointer in each node. This will be compensated by the memory

reduction in the sparse vector, and in some cases the pointer may

fill the gap of alignment without actually increasing memory usage.

2. Cost of calling the virtual functions (AddChanged() and the

destructor).



Pinpoint job [1] shows no regression of motionmark with this CL. (The

small progressions of leaves and suites are from crrev.com/c/5318197.)



[1] https://pinpoint-dot-chromeperf.appspot.com/job/140996ec9e0000

entry.title: [WebAuthn] Reference count cached signing keys in EnclaveManager
entry.content:
These keys are owned by the EnclaveManager, but they are used in

asynchronous calls to crypto signing methods and there might be corner

cases where they get deleted when a call is outstanding. This change

adds a reference-counted version of UserVerifyingSigningKey and

uses that, along with the existing reference-counted wrapper for

UnexportableSigningKey.

entry.title: [DBSC] Extract a base class from CanonicalCookie
entry.content:
This pulls CanonicalCookie apart into a base class, CookieBase. Most of

the data fields are pulled into CookieBase, along with the methods that

check inclusion on cookie read/write. CanonicalCookie retains some data

members that are not needed in the base class, and methods that allow

creation of an actual CanonicalCookie. The base class has its

constructors protected. A couple of small things are pulled out of

canonical_cookie.{h,cc} to allow use in the base class.



The base class will be used to implement DBSC.

entry.title: cellular: Refresh installed profiles
entry.content:
This change updates the "add eSIM" dialog to refresh the installed

profiles immediately when opened. This preserves the behavior of the

dialog when the SM-DS Support feature flag is disabled; this discrepancy

arose after we made the dialog require manual consent to perform an

SM-DS scan, and the previous SM-DS scan internally refreshed the

installed profile list.



Manual test steps:

+ Open "add eSIM" dialog

+ Observe we immediately start refreshing profile list

+ Skip to manual entry

+ Enter eSIM profile information

+ Begin installation before refreshing finishes

+ Observe that we continue refreshing profile list, and afterwards begin

installing the eSIM profile



Bug: b/326163082

Test: Manually on device and unit tests.

entry.title: Fix a crash in GetUserAffiliationStatus
entry.content:
Calls to BrowserDMTokenStorage such as

policy::BrowserDMTokenStorage::Get()->RetrieveDMToken()

are no longer valid on Lacros since the removal of CBCM

(see referenced bug for additional context).



Avoid such a call in GetUserAffiliationStatus by using

policy::GetDMToken instead, which does the right thing on Lacros.

This fixes a crash in chrome://policy for secondary profiles.

Also add a regression test for that.



I could not find any other problematic calls.

entry.title: [omnibox] Improve debug info for shortcuts in chrome://omnibox
entry.content:
1) When multiple shortcuts to the same stripped URL are deduped,

chrome://omnibox currently displays 'number_of_hits' for 1 of the

deduped shortcuts. With this CL, it'll instead show the sum of hits.

This is more useful as it's what's used for scoring and because

search shortcuts have many duplicates with 1 hit each because of SRP

query params.



2) Likewise for 'last access time'; currently the time for 1 of the

deduped shortcuts is shown. With this CL, the most recent time across

the deduped shortcuts is shown.



3) This CL adds 'shortest shortcut text length' to the debug info.



No behavior change.

entry.title: [Windows][dPWA] Fix PWA ToolbarButton icon color not matching rest of controls sometimes
entry.content:
For some theme colors (ex. #529456) PWA toolbar buttons (ie. back/refresh, WCO toggle, extensions, ... menu) have a different foreground color than the title, window controls, and origin text.



ToolbarButtons get their foreground color from ToolbarButton::GetForegroundColor, while the title/window controls/origin text get foreground color from BrowserNonClientFrameViewWin::GetCaptionColor.



ToolbarButton::GetForeground color uses color mixer ids that are missing PWA-specific overrides in AppBrowserController::AddColorMixers. This CL adds those overrides.



See this doc for screenshots/details:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kwfMJ5r9JY-R8EudHlNOhyq8pNd9OjTFQAQb2HzIFqc/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: WebUI TypeScript Mojo bindings: Update type definitions to match runtime
entry.content:
At runtime, nullable struct fields are set to null, not to undefined.

Update the type annotation to match. i.e.:



Previously:

interface Foo {

x?: string,

}



After this CL, this becomes

interface Foo {

x: (string|null),

}



Note: also investigated changing the runtime behavior to not

populate optional struct fields when they are set to null (which

indicates they are unset). This would be more intuitive from the

perspective of Chromium TypeScript development (i.e., would not

require explicitly setting null as is done in this CL). However,

this modification appears to break some assumptions in Blink, so

is likely infeasible at least for the short term. See

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5280348



Bug: 1442785, 1293911

entry.title: [crypto] Fix UnexportableKeyMac bug
entry.content:
UnexportableKeyMac relies on SecKeyCopyAttributes returning the

SecKeyRef along the rest of the key attributes, which was the behaviour

of the test fake. Unfortunately, the real API does not do this, so the

code does not work against the real keychain. Fix this.

entry.title: base/test/launcher: Return non-zero exit code upon ICU loading errors
entry.content:
When ICU data loading fails, the unit test launcher does not run any

unit tests. However, previously, it would return with a zero exit code.

This led to some ChromeOS test failures going unnoticed.



This change uses CHECK to log the fatal error. This prints the callstack

for the InitializeICU call and sets the exit code to 255.



Bug: 327283961

Test: Verified test behavior with and without icudtl.dat present.

Change-Id: I01d1c1ab094a3f63d9f0061b8b68f5f040015f87

entry.title: [Autofill] Eliminate AutofillPopupDelegate deletion callback
entry.content:
This CL removes a mechanism by which AutofillPopupDelegates informs

the AutofillPopupControllerImpl about its destruction, to which

AutofillPopupControllerImpl reacts by hiding itself.



There are three implementations of AutofillPopupDelegates:

- AutofillExternalDelegate

- PasswordAutofillManager

- PasswordManualFallbackFlow



All of them are (directly or indirectly) owned by

Content{Autofill,PasswordManager}Driver, who are destroyed only in

content::WebContentsObserver::RenderFrameDeleted().



AutofillPopupControllerImpl hides itself on RenderFrameDeleted().

So the deletion callback isn't needed.



The deletion callback is annoying in tests, by the way, because it

leads to non-virtual calls of virtual functions of

ContentAutofillDriver (maybe not now but when making other changes).



Bug: 41492848

Change-Id: I910072c11e834663edb2b91f8cb6a9aae896dffc

Cq-Do-Not-Cancel-Tryjobs: true

entry.title: [Start Surface] Remove START_SURFACE_REFACTOR flag
entry.content:
Start Surface Refactor launched in M121 and now that M122 is stable it

is safe to cleanup.



This CL removes the START_SURFACE_REFACTOR flag. However, it does not

remove any code associated with the refactor. Most of the code changed

by the refactor is still behind the method

ReturnToChromeUtils#isStartSurfaceRefactorEnabled. That method now

always returns true. Over time we can then remove references to that

method from the codebase in small pieces.



This CL does cleanup a large number of tests that previously used

the refactor flag.



Skip flakiness check because too many tests names are changed due to

dropping RefactorEnabled/Disabled leading to timeouts.



Note to sheriffs. If any of the tests changed in this CL flake just

disable the test and assign to me. I'll look at it.

BrowserContext is destroyed. This was causing tests in

entry.title: Clean up WebPrint* APIs in Blink somewhat.
entry.content:
Blink knows the default page description, so requiring callers to set up

a WebPrintPageDescription object isn't really necessary for

GetPageDescription(). Change from taking an in/out

WebPrintPageDescription parameter to returning one instead.



Move ignore_css_margins and ignore_page_size out of

WebPrintPageDescription. These are input to Blink when generating print

layout and have nothing to do with a specific page. Therefore a better

home for them is WebPrintParams. Because of this change, pass

WebPrintParams, rather than WebPrintPageDescription, into Blink, when

printing.



Now that Blink relies on being provisioned with a default page

description upon LocalFrame::StartPrinting(), we need to make sure that

we don't call into Blink when this hasn't happened (i.e. when printing

plug-ins). Therefore prevent Document::GetPageDescription() from being

called under such circumstances, and instead handle it on the outside.

Also, in order to reduce the number of entry-points (and thus reduce the

number of such guards guards needed from 2 to 1), remove

GetPageSizeType() from the WebLocalFrame API, and move this field to

WebPrintPageDescription.



Change-Id: I1eaa77b6d33125b22ab5ac3ce19bff1b2c5d5e8d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5327506

Commit-Queue: Morten Stenshorne

Reviewed-by: Dave Tapuska

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

entry.title: Remove unused cert code
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/2421633 added this file, and originally it had

two policies: one that disabled revocation checking, and one basic

X.509 policy to mimic how SFCertificatePanel behaved with no specified

policies.



The revocation checking policy was removed in

https://crrev.com/c/3657565, but the large comment explaining why it

was there was never removed. Therefore, remove that large comment.



The basic X.509 policy is therefore not needed, because it was only

there to mimic there being no policies, and it's easier to just have

no policies.



Therefore, inline what’s left into its sole caller.

entry.title: vt: Fix resource id sequencing cross-process
entry.content:
Resource IDs for view transition snapshots are assigned using a

base::AtomicSequence in Blink. However, this uses a process-static

counter. When performing a view transition to a prerendred page, the two

pages are in separate processes so the ids generated for new snapshots

may collide with old snapshot ids.



This CL makes three conceptual changes:



First we pass the next_id from the old document to the new one in the

view transition state so that the id sequence can be continued in the

new document, even if it's in a separate process.



Second, the id sequence is moved onto the per-Document

ViewTransitionSupplement to ensure there isn't any confusion between

transitions occurring in separate documents being rendered in the same

process.



Last, the ViewTransitionElementResourceID type is turned into a tuple

consisting of a per-transition UnguessableToken "transition id" and a

per-snapshot "id". The transition id is preserved across the old and new

Document's ViewTransition object by being passed through the

ViewTransitionState. The individual snapshot "id"s are guaranteed to be

unique only within a specific "transition id". This ensures snapshot ids

from separate transitions being applied within the same compositor

instance cannot colide.



Note: The "navigation id" of a capture request and used in viz to allow

sharing resources between separate documents when they're transitioning

is a separate identifier but requires only that the id be the same for

old and new captures and unique across transitions. The "transition id"

has these properties so is used to set the navigation id in this case.

However, unlike the transition id, for same-document navigations it

continues to be an empty id.



Fixed: 41496294

Change-Id: I3d50fb6c91ee844ab1506217f921170eefd0bcde

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5314213

Reviewed-by: danakj

Commit-Queue: David Bokan

Reviewed-by: Vladimir Levin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266655}

entry.title: Prepare Abseil for using flags in test-only binaries.
entry.content:
In component builds, //third_party/abseil-cpp:absl directly includes

the additional targets for flags support.



However, in non-component builds, flags support is built into a separate

static library. This has several advantages for Chrome:

- absl_flags is marked as testonly, so non-test binaries cannot use it.

- it prevents absl_flags static initializers from being included in

non-test binaries.

- it will allow the gn check exception for GoogleTest to be removed in

a followup



The main disadvantage is that test infrastructure that uses absl flags

needs to add an additional dependency in component builds.



Bug: 326607005

Change-Id: Ied0c31d40ea900fe73f89a872dc6c86614b16baf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5324732

Reviewed-by: Danil Chapovalov

entry.title: Mahi: Add use-fake-mahi-manager to facilitate UI development
entry.content:
When passing in the switch --use-fake-mahi-manager, the UI will use the

fake manager instead of the real one. This helps us with the UI

development and decouple the UI from the backend work.



This CL also moves FakeMahiManager to //ash, since this class will now

only be used by //ash and also use some capabilities in //ash.

entry.title: Fix mac primary plane z-order
entry.content:
Mac ignores the `plane_z_order` field and passes along the overlay

candidates to core animation in the order received. With the switch to

BufferQueue the primary plane when from being last entry in the list to

first. With protected video content this changes the primary plane from

on top to underneath. Fix the z-order by inserting primary plane into

the front of the list.



Bug: 326802951, 40224327

entry.title: Make sure all a11y expectations have a newline at the end.
entry.content:
Changes all expectations in the

content/test/data/accessibility/... subtree to have newlines.



Also changes tools/accessibility/rebase_dump_accessibility_tree_test.py to ensure a newline at the end of all baselines.



This is a follow-on to CL 5322634.



Currently, it appears that some of the expectation files have a

newline and some do not. The code that checks expectations match

accepts either variant.



This mostly becomes a problem when using the

tools/accessibility/rebase_dump_accessibility_tree_test.py helper

script to automate rebaselines, because if the bot outputs a result

that disagrees with whether the local file has a newline, the result

will cause a rebaseline that doesn't matter, which makes code reviews

unnecessarily harder, as the reviewer will need to check these files

and find the changes to be no-ops.



Changes automated by:



find content/test/data/accessibility/ -name *.txt | xargs sed -i -e '$a\'



Change-Id: Ib07a75c350c78cca41f294f0ea73d85419a14317

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5329232

Commit-Queue: Chris Harrelson

Reviewed-by: Mark Schillaci

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1266643}
